alert.note: Alert for O'Brien; Osceola (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 22 at 5:34AM CDT until April 22 at 5:45AM CDT by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 AM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN OSCEOLA AND NORTHEASTERN O`BRIEN COUNTIES... At 533 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Melvin, or 10 miles southeast of Sibley, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to vehicles is expected. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Osceola and northeastern O`Brien Counties, between Melvin and Ocheyedan. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: This storm is producing large hail. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
